etymology.description: Phonetic: 者(者) (zhě) + Semantic: 艸(艸, "grass") -> 著(著) (existing character) corrupted as 着(着) (草 and 日 changed to 䒑 and 目) -> 着(着)
etymology.interpretation: Originally, 著(著) combined 艸(艸, "grass") for meaning with 者(者) for sound. The character 着(着) later developed as an unorthodox variant by corrupting 著(著), changing grass 艸 to the simplified component 䒑, and 日(目, "sun") to 目(目, "eye").
etymology.simplification: The character was transformed from 著(著) by simplifying 艸 to 䒑 and 日 to 目, making it easier to write.

examples.chinese: 他穿着新衣服(他穿著新衣服)。
雨一直下着(雨一直下著)。
小猫蹲在椅子上(小貓蹲在椅子上)，静静地看着鱼缸(靜靜地看著魚缸)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo māo dūn zài yǐzi shàng, jìngjìng de kànzhe yúgāng.
examples.english: The kitten crouches on the chair, quietly watching the fish tank.
